result.execSummary:
The defendant Joe Anthony Gutierrez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Compulsory School Attendance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 118.15(1)(a).
  • Compulsory School Attendance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 118.15(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joe Anthony Gutierrez

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant sentenced to serve FIFTEEN (15) DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence BUT CONCURRENT TO COUNT 2 with credit for FIFTEEN (15) DAYS time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

AS TO COUNT 2:

Defendant sentenced to serve FIFTEEN (15) DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence BUT CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1 with credit for FIFTEEN (15) DAYS time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

OTHER CONDITIONS:

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and fees BY 07-23-2020 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Joe Anthony Gutierrez in court with Student Intern Rebecca Steck under attorney Victoria McCandless for Amanda M. Parent.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State RENEWED their motion to REVOKE the DPA.  Defense and Defendant CONCEDED that there is a FACTUAL basis for the REVOCATION.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  Matter proceeded to Sentencing before Br. 33.

Review hearing scheduled for July 23, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Defendant Joe Anthony Gutierrez in court with attorney Steven Rees Wiechmann.  Kristyn R Kuzniar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Count 1 and 2:

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the case transferred to Judge Ashley, Branch 33 for a review hearing.  Review hearing scheduled for September 11, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joe Anthony Gutierrez in court with attorney Steven Rees Wiechmann.  Kristyn R Kuzniar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for Deferred prosecution agreement hearing. Defense counsel requests more time to complete the DPA. Court ordered case adjourned for Deferred prosecution agreement hearing in Branch 47.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 11, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

  Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 47.
  Status conference scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office.  Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br.47.
Defendant Joe Anthony Gutierrez in court.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Joe Anthony Gutierrez not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
